thread.title: H.S. FOOTBALL: Spellman holds off St. Mary's
thread.title_full: H.S. FOOTBALL: Spellman holds off St. Mary's

author: Jonathan Lyons Enterprise Correspondent
title: H.S. FOOTBALL: Spellman holds off St. Mary's
text: Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 12:37 AM Updated at 12:42 AM BROCKTON Cardinal Spellman High School defeated St. Mary’s of Lynn, 35-28, in Catholic Central League football on a crisp Friday night. The game came down to the wire, with Spellman scoring with 1:27 to play for the win. Cardinal Spellman quarterback Mike Reale scored the game-winning touchdown, breaking a 28-28 tie on a third-down run from the 1-yard line. Spellman started the scoring on its first drive of the game. A 38-yard run by Ralph Grilone put the Cardinals in Spartan territory. Cameron Sass capped off the drive with a 3-yard touchdown run to put the Cardinals up, 7-0. St. Mary’s answered on the ensuing drive with a 66-yard touchdown run by Calvin Johnson. On a first down from the Spartans 33-yard line, Reale heaved a 31-yard pass that was hauled in by Andrew Dudley, who caught the ball one-handed while diving to the ground. Sass then scored from the 2. The Spartans closed out the first half scoring on a 9-yard touchdown pass from Antonio Felix to Abraham Toe. A blocked punt by Spellman’s Andrew Force set the Cardinals up at St. Mary’s 17-yard line. A few plays later, Reale kept the ball for a touchdown to put Spellman up, 21-12. The Spartans answered on their next drive with a touchdown run by Toe. The play was set up by an excellent leaping catch by Marcus Atkins on a 4th and eight. The two-point conversion was good and the score was 21-20 heading into the fourth quarter. On Spellman’s second possession of the fourth, Reale executed a great play fake and scampered for a 50-yard touchdown run to put the Cardinals up, 28-20. Johnson broke free down the sideline on the Spartans’ next drive and hauled in a 38-yard touchdown pass. The two-point conversion was good and the score was tied up at 28-28 with 5:44 to go. Spellman got the ball back and began marching down the field as time ticked down. Reale again hit Dudley on a long pass play, this time for 30 yards to the Spartans’ 6-yard line to set up the game-winning score. Saint Mary’s had one final chance but turned the ball over on downs at the Spellman 43 to end the game. By Jonathan Lyons The Patriot Ledger, Quincy, MA By Jonathan Lyons Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 12:37 AM Updated at 12:42 AM
